meanings.definition: The ability to be trafficked or traveled on.
meanings.sent1: The trafficability of the road was excellent, allowing cars to move smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The trafficability of the bridge was crucial for the safe passage of vehicles.
meanings.sent3: The trafficability of the sidewalk made it a popular route for pedestrians.
meanings.sent4: The trafficability of the path through the forest was like a welcoming invitation to explore.
meanings.sent5: The trafficability of the highway was so good that even during rush hour, traffic flowed freely.

meanings.definition: The quality of being suitable for traffic or transportation.
meanings.sent1: The trafficability of the newly constructed road was impressive, allowing heavy trucks to pass through easily.
meanings.sent2: The trafficability of the airport runway was essential for the smooth landing of airplanes.
meanings.sent3: The trafficability of the bicycle lane made cycling a breeze for commuters.
meanings.sent4: The trafficability of the river was so smooth that boats glided effortlessly along its surface.
meanings.sent5: The trafficability of the train tracks ensured timely and efficient transportation of goods.
